data.title: DIRECTORY OF SOVIET OFFICIALS: REPUBLIC ORGANIZATIONS
data.text: Declassified and Approved For Release 2012/10/25: CIA-RDP07000121 R001000520001-1 V Intelligence Directory of Soviet Officials: Republic Organizations LDA 88-15256 (Supersedes LDA 87-10509) November 1988 Declassified and Approved For Release 2012/10/25: CIA-RDP07000121 R001000520001-1 Declassified and Approved For Release 2012/10/25: CIA-RDP07000121 R001000520001-1 Directory of Soviet Officials: Republic Organizations Information available as of 1 November 1988 was used in the preparation of this publication. LDA 88-15256 (Supersedes LDA 87-10509) November 1988 Declassified and Approved For Release 2012/10/25: CIA-RDP07000121 R001000520001-1 Declassified and Approved For Release 2012/10/25: CIA-RDP07000121 R001000520001-1 Preface The Directory of Soviet Officials identifies individuals who hold positions in selected party, government, and other public organizations of the USSR. It may be used to find the incumbents of given positions within an organizations or the positions of given individuals. For some organizations, it serves as a guide to the internal structure of some of these organizations. Coverage. This publication supersedes Directory of Soviet Officials: Republic Organizations (LDA 87-10509, March 1987). It is one of a three-volume series: the other volumes deal with na- tional-level organizations and with scientific and. educational organizations. The Republic directory begins with the Russian Soviet Federated Socialist Republic (RSFSR)-by far the largest republic in the USSR-followed by special sections for Moscow and Leningrad, the nation's two largest cities. The other republics follow in English alphabetical order. An index to major organizations, and a personality index are included at the. end of the publication. Duplicate names in the personality index refer to different individuals who have the same name. Directory Abbreviations and Dates. The date an individual assumed his position is listed in the "position" column. Dates are preceded by the abbreviations "ap" (appointed), "el" (elected), or "id" (identified in the position). Partial dates are. given when exact dates are not known (for example, when identifications are taken from books or periodicals). Dates of birth are listed in the "birth" column when known. In most cases, only the last two digits of a year are listed. For example, 97 refers to 1897, 00 indicates 1900, and 17 indicates 1917. Names are giv- en in full where known. A list of abbreviations follows the Table of Contents. Rendering of Proper Names. Transliteration generally follows. the system authorized by the Board of Geographic Names (BGN). Non-Russian names (such as those of Ukrainian or Estonian origin) for which original Latin alphabet spellings or separate BGN transliteration systems exist are treated as Russian names and are transliterated from their Russian spellings. (For instance, the Ukrainian surname "Honchar" is rendered "Gonchar.") Exceptions are the city of Kiev (BGN spelling is Kiyev) and the names of the republics themselves, which reflect ac- cepted Westernized forms ("Lithuania" for "Litva," "Georgia" for "Gruziya," etc.). The Russian words kray, oblast, okrug, and rayon-standard terms for territorial and administrative units in the USSR-are not translated. Place names have been translated where possible (Primorskiy kray, for example, is rendered as Maritime Kray), and Russian adjectival endings have been eliminated in translation (Leningradskaya oblast is rendered as Leningrad Oblast). Soft signs have been omitted from the English renderings of place names. Organizations. An effort has been made to verify and standardize the names of organiza- tional components and the position titles of individuals, but some unverified entries remain for names whose sole source is a non-Soviet publication. Date of Information. This volume reflects information received by 1 November 1988. Republic level population and Communist Party membership statistics are based on January 1987 data unless otherwise noted and are drawn from the Great Soviet Encyclopedia 1987 Yearbook. Oblast or other regional population figures reflect January 1982 data unless otherwise noted and are drawn from Narodnoye Khozyaystvo SSSR 1922-1982 (National Economy USSR 1922-1982). Declassified and Approved For Release 2012/10/25: CIA-RDP07000121 R001000520001-1 Declassified and Approved For Release 2012/10/25: CIA-RDP07000121 R001000520001-1 ABBREVIATIONS The following list includes abbreviations used throughout the Direc- tory of Soviet Officials. No attempt has been made to include Russian ac- ronyms for most organizations. If known, an acronym is included at the beginning of the listing for the organization. Adm. Agr.S. A-R Arch: S. Personality Index Declassified and Approved For Release 2012/10/25: CIA-RDP07000121 R001000520001-1 Declassified and Approved For Release 2012/10/25: CIA-RDP07000121 R001000520001-1 1. Russian Soviet Federated Socialist Republic Russian Republic Rossiyskaya Sovetskaya federativnaya sotsialisticheskaya respublika RSFSR Founded on 7 November 1917; incorporated into the USSR on 30 December 1922. Capital is Moscow (Moskva) with a population of 8,801,000--1 January 1987 data. Political subdivisions number six krays, 16 autonomous republics, 49 oblasts, five autonomous oblasts, 10 autonomous okrugs, 1,834 rural rayons, and 1,030 cities--1 January 1987 data. Economy: Agriculture: (Principal food crops are potatoes, sugar beets, grain (wheat, rye, barley), fruit, and vegetables. Principal industrial crops are flax, tobacco, and fodder crops. Principal livestock types are dairy cattle, sheep, and swine.) ........................................ Major Industries: (Heavy industry, energy production, transportation machinery, other machinery, petroleum, textiles, chemicals, cement, metallurgy, mining and minerals (coal, gold, tin, copper, iron, mica, lead, manganese, diamonds, rocksalt, asbestos, graphite, aluminum, flur spar, uranium), and timber and wood processing.) ............................................................
